name: Cambria Pines Lodge

reviews.title: Seen Better Days
reviews.text: Nice setting in a wooded area of Cambria just off Highway 1 on the Big . Our room was in an old wooden building opposite the main reception and restaurant area. Convenient parking immediately outside the rooms which was accessed by a flight of wooden stairs. First observation was a musty smell from corridor carpet which could have done with a deep clean. Room was a good size with a view of trees and shrubs. Furniture old and rickety rather than quaint and period and poorly matched. No safe and no fridge which for the price in this day and age was poor. Room was very warm and no air conditioning so window needed to be opened to cool room. Two comfortable Queen beds and bedding clean and ironed, always a plus. Bathroom and wash hand basin in separate rooms which was a bit strange and the bath/shower was complicated to operate and water continues to come out of bath tap when shower was on reducing shower pressure. Plumbing very loud! Very little room round wash hand basin and you have to compete with coffee maker balanced at edge of sink and the wardrobe immediately behind. Daft arrangement! No laundry facilities, though laundry bag provided? TV old and poor picture. Bar was chaotic with pressured unsmiling staff, efficient enough when you forced way through bar stools to get there. Restaurant good quality for price. Friends with us asked to move to another room but were told nothing available, so we didn't bother. Would not stay again but will tolerate for two nights.
Please be warned the pictures of these rooms posred on hotel website do not match the reallity, there is a point in time when shabby chic, just becomes shabby, dirty walls, carpets poor furniture.
reviews.title: Please do not book a standard room

reviews.text: Sadly by the time we had talked to staff at reception, they had moved so many others we had to stay with our allocatted rooms.
reviews.title: Family Oriented Retreat
The almost resort
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here to enjoy a clan gathering for five days over Labor Day Week end. One of our nieces and her family of five stayed in a larger suite on the property. The Lodge was at maximum capacity yet the knowledgeable and helpful staff kept everything running smoothly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds and gardens are extensive and lovely.
reviews.title: It is in a Beautiful Garden Setting....

reviews.text: cute cottage for $250 a night, but tv was from the 80's and the waiters were untrained except for one man who we did not get at our table...ok cause its pretty cool havin your own pad to stay in...pool was nice also...food ok
reviews.title: ok but could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at Cambria Pines Lodge. The breakfast was good: fresh fruit and muffins, scrambled eggs, sausage. The room was mostly clean, except for stains on the carpet. The room was roomy: fireplace, small patio, room to read and sit. The grounds are lovely: extensive and beautiful flowers. The hike down the stairs to town is fun and invigorating. The dinner was horrible!!! The staff very little experienced in the way of fine dining: asked if they could take our plate when we were half finished. The salad was inedible.
reviews.title: comfy, inexpensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 3rd stay this year, twice in Superior Rooms with our dog & once in a Large Suite with friends. We originally had regular reservations & the staff was more than happy to lower our rate & include dinner & a bottle of wine for each night when the special package became available. We had other plans one evening so they gave us the bottle of wine to take home. That's the best & most accomodating service we've had anywhere! The Superior Rooms were lovely, quite large and current, with a nice deck overlooking a wooded area where we could photograph lots of different birds & our Border Collie watched several deer saunter by. The Large Suite's furnishings were a bit older but it was clean, comfortable & just right for our group of friends wanting a quiet place to catch up & reminisce. The included breakfast has great variety, with everything from fresh fruit to yogurt & cereals to eggs, potatoes & sausage. Their muffins are wonderful! Their dinner menu is competitively priced & the food is very good. It's a short walk into one part of Cambria with lots of shops & restaurants, & just a few minutes drive to the other part of town & the beach areas. We'll be back, hopefully again before the end of the year.
reviews.title: We love Cambria Pines Lodge!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Scott pleasantly surprised me with a 2 day getaway to the Cambria Pines Lodge. First of all it is less than 40 miles from where we live and it is like going to paradise. He was able to get one of their special deals that you go a very nice room, dinner for 2 and brunch included and a very reasonable price.
reviews.title: If you want to relax and see beautiful things - stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were incredible, dinner was sensational, but brunch was OK. We elected to eat somewhere else the second morning as they serve the same fare every day for breakfast.
reviews.title: Cambria Pine Lodge

reviews.text: My family and I just stayed here the one night on a drive up the coast from LA to SF. We stayed in one of the suites and found it roomy and and comfortable and the rustic feel was nice. If we had more time it would have been nice to just spend an afternoon with a bottle of wine on the verandah. The staff were attentive enough for check in/out.
reviews.title: Wish we had more time here

reviews.text: On the advice of friends who have a family reunion here every year, my girlfriends and I stayed here two nights. We were here to see the Hearst Castle, about 8 miles from Cambria, and we're so glad we took their advice The "new part" of the hotel is recently finished and each of our rooms had two queens, a tub and bath, a private little patio, TV and free wifi as well as complimentary breakfast. AND there are $3 well drinks at happy hour in the lounge with a huge screen!
reviews.title: What a lovely place!
Love this place, it's heaven
reviews.text: This is a tourist destination and there are bus tours here, but the staff is competent and quick to respond.
We would stay here again.
reviews.title: beautiful lodge in a garden setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A caveat: we were here in the hottest two days in California history and the Cambria Pines doesn't have air conditioning. It cooled off nicely at night, but when it is 105 during the day, the rooms are hot when we got back from our tours.
reviews.title: Avoid this place!

reviews.text: We stayed her with our two children while driving up the coast of California for one evening. Previously we had been staying in large resort type of hotels on the trip. The Cambria Pines Lodge was a welcome change. The kids loved that there was a cat to welcome them at the reception desk. We were trying to get to Moonstone Beach for sunset so we quickly checked in and dropped our bags. Our room was adequate with two queen beds and a lovely private fenced patio. The carpet and furnishings were a bit "tired" but everything was clean and the beds were comfy.
reviews.title: Nice place near Hearst Castle

reviews.text: For sunset we drove down to Moonstone Beach and climbed out ont to the rocks. It was absolutely stunning. I assumed that we would find a place at the beach or in town for dinner but after checking a few choices which were either very pricey or did not have children options we ended back at the Cambria Pines Lodge and had a wonderfully delicious meal! Ironicaly the kids had wanted to head back just to see the cat again. While everything else in town was almost vacant with the exception of two restaurants on Moonstone Beach the lodge's restaurant was quite busy and we even had to wait for a few minutes. It was clear that many in the area came to the lodge for dinner. We loved the tavern where we waited for a few minutes and then the warm dining room. The breakfast the next morning was quite good also.
reviews.title: Good place for a quiet retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed the stay. It was perfect for an early morning tour of Hearst Castle the next day.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: The problem here is the location. It is not within easy walking distance of the town of Cambria or Moonstone Beach. Dinner was very good. King size bed with adjoining living room was spacious but not worth the high price ($340). Beautiful park-like grounds. It would be a good place for a business retreat to get away from it all in a quiet setting. It did not work out for us because we had to get in the car to do anything like go to the beach or window shopping in town.
reviews.title: Huge suite, suitable for family or 2 couples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would stay here again! We had a large king size bed room with small balcony looking over the vegtable gardens. This is a older facility but it is clean and comfortable. The restaurant has delicious food. If you are wanting an ocean view this is not the place but the ocean is only a short drive away.
reviews.title: Reasonable for a Highway 1 stopover

description: Nestled on 25 wooded acres, Cambria Pines Lodge offers something for everyone. Accommodations range from rustic cabins to elegant suites. Amenities include an outdoor pool and spa, day spa, free parking, and free Wi-Fi. The Main Lodge offers an excellent restaurant featuring local wines, the Fireside Lounge with nightly live entertainment, and conference rooms with full-service catering, all surrounded by world-class gardens. The organic kitchen garden provides homegrown organic produce to the restaurant at Cambria Pines Lodge, while other areas of the theme gardens offer spectacular landscaping.
